00032 //
00033 //
00034 // TEMPLATE OPERATIONS
00035 // This way of overloading operators is a very efficient way of doing
00036 // long operations of the type C = A + B + C with classes.
00037 // These ugly to read templates expand to the equivalent C code of 
00038 // processing each channel individually, unlike your traditional C++
00039 // vector class.
00040 //
00041 // For explanation of why it works, see: 
00042 // Jim Blinn's Notation, Notation, Notation
00043 // or 
00044 // Faster Vector Math Using Templates By Tomas Arce
00045 //
00046 #ifndef mrBase_h
00047 #define mrBase_h
00048 
00049 #ifndef SHADER_H
00050 #include "shader.h"
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #ifndef mrMacros_h
00054 #include "mrMacros.h"
00055 #endif
00056

00072 // ARGUMENTS
00074 
00075 template< typename ta_a >
00076 class vecarg
00077 {
00078      const ta_a& Argv;
00079    public:
00080      inline vecarg( const ta_a& A ) : Argv( A ) {}
00081      inline const double Evaluate( const unsigned short i ) const 
00082      { return Argv.Evaluate( i ); }
00083 };
00084 
00085 template<>
00086 class vecarg< const unsigned short >
00087 {
00088      const unsigned short& Argv;
00089    public:
00090      inline vecarg( const unsigned short& A ) : Argv( A ) {}
00091      inline const double Evaluate( const unsigned short i ) const 
00092      { return Argv; }
00093 };
00094 
00095 template<>
00096 class vecarg< const unsigned int >
00097 {
00098      const unsigned int& Argv;
00099    public:
00100      inline vecarg( const unsigned int& A ) : Argv( A ) {}
00101      inline const double Evaluate( const unsigned short i ) const 
00102      { return Argv; }
00103 };
00104 
00105 template<>
00106 class vecarg< const short >
00107 {
00108      const short& Argv;
00109    public:
00110      inline vecarg( const short& A ) : Argv( A ) {}
00111      inline const double Evaluate( const unsigned short i ) const 
00112      { return Argv; }
00113 };

00228 // EXPRESSION
00230 
00231 template< class ta_a, class ta_b, class ta_eval >
00232 class exp
00233 {
00234      const vecarg< ta_a >   Arg1;
00235      const vecarg< ta_b >   Arg2;
00236 
00237    public:
00238 
00239      inline exp( const ta_a& A1, const ta_b& A2 ) : Arg1( A1 ), Arg2( A2 ) {}
00240      inline const double Evaluate ( const unsigned short i ) const
00241      { return ta_eval::Evaluate( i, Arg1, Arg2 ); }
00242 };

00250 
00252 // ADDITION
00254 
00255 struct add
00256 {
00257      template< class ta_a, class ta_b >
00258      inline static 
00259      const double Evaluate( const unsigned short i, const ta_a& A, 
00260                             const ta_b& B )
00261      { return A.Evaluate(i) + B.Evaluate(i); }
00262 };
00263 
00265 // SUBSTRACTION
00267 
00268 struct sub
00269 {
00270      template< class ta_a, class ta_b >
00271      inline static 
00272      const double Evaluate( const unsigned short i, const ta_a& A, 
00273                             const ta_b& B )
00274      { return A.Evaluate(i) - B.Evaluate(i); }
00275 };
00276 
00278 // MULTIPLICATION
00280 
00281 struct mult
00282 {
00283      template< class ta_a, class ta_b >
00284      inline static 
00285      const double Evaluate( const unsigned short i, const ta_a& A, 
00286                             const ta_b& B )
00287      { return A.Evaluate(i) * B.Evaluate(i); }
00288 };
00289 
00291 // DIVISION
00293 
00294 struct div
00295 {
00296      template< class ta_a, class ta_b >
00297      inline static 
00298      const double Evaluate( const unsigned short i, const ta_a& A, 
00299                             const ta_b& B )
00300      { return A.Evaluate(i) / B.Evaluate(i); }
00301 };
00302 
00303 
00304 template< class ta_c1, class ta_c2 > 
00305 inline 
00306 const mr::base::exp< const ta_c1, const ta_c2, add > 
00307 operator+( const ta_c1& Pa, const ta_c2& Pb )
00308 {
00309    return exp< const ta_c1, const ta_c2, add >( Pa, Pb );
00310 }
00311 
00312 
00313 template< class ta_c1, class ta_c2 > 
00314 inline 
00315 const exp< const ta_c1, const ta_c2, sub > 
00316 operator-( const ta_c1& Pa, const ta_c2& Pb )
00317 {
00318    return exp< const ta_c1, const ta_c2, sub >( Pa, Pb );
00319 }
00320 
00321 
00322 
00323 template< class ta_c1, class ta_c2 > 
00324 inline 
00325 const exp< const ta_c1, const ta_c2, mult > 
00326 operator*( const ta_c1& Pa, const ta_c2& Pb )
00327 {
00328    return exp< const ta_c1, const ta_c2, mult >( Pa, Pb );
00329 }
00330 
00331 
00332 
00333 template< class ta_c1, class ta_c2 > 
00334 inline 
00335 const exp< const ta_c1, const ta_c2, div > 
00336 operator/( const ta_c1& Pa, const ta_c2& Pb )
00337 {
00338    return exp< const ta_c1, const ta_c2, div >( Pa, Pb );
00339 }
